If you see a HD install icon in the CD then you can. If not then you have the "old" version
Ubuntu will see windows and ask if you want to shrink it to make room for Ubuntu (you need free space in Wndows in order to shrink it) then you get a choice when you boot for windows or ubuntu
It is much easier to set up with Dapper though, as it has graphics (Breezy install CD is text-based)
You cannot install from breezy livecd (like you have), it is not hidden away, it is not there
If you download the Dapper cd you will not be able to save it if you use windows xp (linux cannot write to ntfs partitions) unless you save it to a usb drive or something
